Prior Codifications

1981 Ed., § 1-1165.

Effect of Amendments

D.C. Law 19-84 rewrote the section, which formerly read:

"The Mayor shall issue rules to carry out the purposes of this part not later than 60 days after June 29, 1984."

Legislative History of Laws

For legislative history of D.C. Law 5-93, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 2-219.01.

For history of Law 19-84, see notes under § 2-219.01.

Delegation of Authority

Delegation of authority pursuant to Law 5-93, see Mayor's Order 86-66, April 22, 1986.

DC CODE § 2-219.05

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: (1) Except as provided in § 2-219.03(e)(1B) and (1C), within 180 days of February 24, 2012, the Mayor, pursuant to subchapter I of Chapter 5 of this title, shall issue rules to implement the provisions of the Workforce Act.

The proposed rules shall be submitted to the Council for a 45-day period of review, excluding Saturdays, Sundays, legal holidays, and days of Council recess. If the Council does not approve or disapprove the proposed rules, in whole or in part, by resolution within this 45-day review period, the rules shall be deemed approved.
Any subsequent rules issued by the Mayor to implement the provisions of this part shall be submitted to the Council for a 45-day period of review in accordance with subsection (a)(2) of this section.
